intro: Grammosciadium macrodon subsp. macrodon, commonly known as the giant lily, is a striking member of the Alstroemeriaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with a distinctive red throat. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
